overview.quote: The algorithm takes those metrics and uses them to quantify how many people, what type of people, and how much people actually liked the video.
overview.introText: Understanding the step-by-step distribution process that social media algorithms use to test, evaluate, and promote content to wider audiences.

mainContent.title: The Initial Test
mainContent.text: Every video gets tested with 150-200 viewers first. Their response determines if your content ever reaches a wider audience. This is your critical first impression.

mainContent.title: Batch Distribution System
mainContent.text: Algorithms distribute content in expanding waves. Each successful batch leads to a larger audience test, which is why viral content often grows in noticeable jumps rather than linearly.

mainContent.title: Fast vs. Slow Virality
mainContent.text: Some videos explode overnight while others grow steadily over days. The difference lies in how confident the algorithm is about audience appeal—universal hits spread faster than niche content.

mainContent.title: The 200-View Plateau
mainContent.text: Getting 'stuck' at low view counts isn't a punishment—it's data showing your content didn't generate enough interest from the test group to warrant further distribution.

proTips.text: Videos that generate intense debate often receive extra distribution because the algorithm sees lengthy comment threads as extended engagement time.

finalWords.emphasis: Every video starts with the same opportunity
finalWords.description: The first 200 viewers are your gateway to millions—make them count!
